text.title: Get a Religious Girl to See Past Agnostic or Atheistic Beliefs
text.head: Get a Religious Girl to See Past Agnostic or Atheistic Beliefs
text.p: Have you ever had trouble getting a date with someone who is religious because of your views ? Showing respect for the person 's beliefs , understanding your differences , and figuring out what you have in common are key when it comes to dating a religious girl . In the end , it 's up to you decide whether your spiritual divide is a dealbreaker or something you can live with .
text.head: Steps

list.item:
Find a woman of faith you like .
Remember people with religious faith vary as much as atheists and agnostics . Find one who has the characteristics you 're looking for in a girlfriend and would consider you as a boyfriend . Remember while many such women would consider dating a person outside her faith , others would not -- or
cannot
.

Show respect for her beliefs . This does n't mean attending religious services or
converting
. You just have to make sure that they know that you are accepting of her faith . Do
not
demand or ask her to do things outside of her religious faith .

Respect and understand cultural , family , or community differences . For some girls and women , dating outside the community can be
extremely difficult and threatening
to her family , friends , and house of worship . If she is an immigrant or first-generation citizen , this is especially true . Be sensitive to the fact girls and women will often encounter a lot of resistance . This may even mean accepting a chaperone on a date , meeting only at school , or being formally approved by the family members .

Serve the
community
. Community service is a key part of nearly all religions . She may be satisfied knowing that you follow the moral codes of her religion , even if you do not believe exactly in what she believes in . Anyway , it 's a good thing to do anyway .

Be incredibly
kind
to her . Treat her with respect . This is obviously a key part of getting anyone to like you , of any belief .
Be patient . It may take time to convince a religious woman that you are honest in your intentions and sincere in your tolerance , so take your time .

Know when to decide if religion is a deal-breaking issue . If you go beyond casual boyfriend and girlfriend relationships , realize that issues of faith can become more serious -- or not . When considering marriage or civil union , the issue of faith becomes increasingly more important as you may start a family . Sometimes , this becomes truly a problem , and marriage cannot be a viable option . But not always , as families sometimes blend beliefs . In either case , it has to be a joint decision by the couple . Seek marital counseling if such problems become too much .

text.head: Tips

list.item: If you are atheist or agnostic , be respectful of those who have faith in religion . It might not be your belief , but be tolerant of others .
If you are interested in the basic tenets on her faith , do some quick Wikipedia research on key figures , deities , and other various beliefs in her religion .
Most people like to have relationships with people they have things in common with . There is no point in having a relationship with someone who thinks completely differently than you .

Think about it and admit it . One of you thinks that the other is completely wrong . If there is such a gap in your way of thinking , then it 's probably not a good idea to pursue a " relationship " that has a huge chance of not working out .

Statements like , " Are n't Christians ( or whatever religion she is)supposed to be kind to all people , even those who do n't share your beliefs ? " can be helpful if the girl is rude to you about religion . But realize it 's not going to help you if you 're a jerk , and then tell her not to be .

text.head: Warnings

list.item:
Do n't lie to her . You 'll compromise your integrity in
your
beliefs , and if she realizes you are faking interest in her religion , she 'll probably dump you .
Do n't convert unless you honestly feel this is the choice for you .

If she is sincere in her beliefs , she probably wo n't really be happy in the long term with anyone who does not share them . Are you more interested in making her happy , or in trying to make yourself happy ?
